result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

10:25 AM Defendant George T. Poupart in court, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder appeared by video for George T. Poupart.  ADA Dennis Brown in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights complied with. No victim appearing today. State speaks to the progress of the case. Defense agrees. Requests adjournment. Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:10 AM Defendant George T. Poupart in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Francis Snyder in court for George T. Poupart.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Lac du Flambeau Police Investigator George Hopfensperger via zoom technology, Katrina Heller of ICW appears via audio technology. Investigator Hopfensperger sworn in and testifies. Defense provides Exhibit 1 report. Exhibit 1 received by court. State gives statement. Defense gives statement. Court finds probable cause.  Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-file information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives formal reading of information.  Not guilty pleas of not guilty entered by court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Katrina Heller of ICW appears by video.  Defense confirms receipt of complaint, waive formal reading.  Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Bond continued.

Preliminary hearing on July 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No contact with B.C.(2009), B.C.(2011), H.C.(2013) and R.P.(2020) unless authorized by ICW or Vilas County Social Services, No contact with co-defendant Sheila Thompson.

3:37 PM Defendant George T. Poupart appeared by video, in custody, without counsel.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Katrina Heller of ICW present via video. D.T. appears via zoom audio.  Defendant provided the complaint in the jail and given time to review.  Defendant confirms receipt of complaint.  Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Court reads charges. Defendant informed of attorney options. Defendant intends to contact the Public Defender's Office.  Court sets bond at $25,000.00 CASH with conditions: No contact with B.C.(2009), B.C.(2011), H.C.(2013) and R.P.(2020) unless authorized by ICW or Vilas County Social Services, No contact with co-defendant Sheila Thompson.
